intro: Euphrasia cuprea, commonly known as the coppery eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia cuprea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
